{{Infobox person | name = S. E. Cupp |image =SECupp-HS5-2010-29-12.jpg |imagesize = 170px |caption = |birth_date = {{Birth date and age|mf=yes|1979|2|23}} |birth_place = [[Carlsbad, California|Carlsbad]], [[California]], [[USA]] |death_place = |occupation = Author, political commentator |alma_mater = B.A., [[Cornell University]]
M.A., [[New York University]] |salary = |networth = |website = [http://www.redsecupp.com redsecupp.com] }} '''Sarah Elizabeth "S. E." Cupp''' (born February 23, 1979) is an American [[conservative]] [[political commentator]] and writer, co-author of the book ''Why You're Wrong About the Right'' with Brett Joshpe, and author of the book ''[[Losing Our Religion: The Liberal Media's Attack on Christianity]].'' == Background== Cupp was born in [[Carlsbad, California]] and raised in [[Andover, Massachusetts]]. In 2000, she graduated from [[Cornell University]] with a degree in [[Art History]]. While attending Cornell, she worked for her college paper, ''[[The Cornell Daily Sun]]''. In 2010, she earned a [[master's degree]] in Religious Studies at [[New York University]].{{cite web|last=Cupp|first=S.E.|title=S.E. Cuppâs Diary: Motherâs Day edition|url=http://dailycaller.com/2010/05/07/s-e-cupps-diary-mothers-day-edition/|publisher=The Daily Caller|accessdate=10 October 2010}} She is a classically trained [[ballet]] dancer and over a period of ten years danced with the Ellicott City Ballet, [[Washington Ballet]], and [[Boston Ballet]]. Cupp describes herself as an [[atheist]][[Alex Pareene|Pareene, Alex]] (2010-11-23) [http://www.salon.com/news/politics/war_room/2010/11/22/hack_list_21/index.html War Room's Hack Thirty - No. 21: S.E. Cupp], ''[[Salon.com]]''{{cite book |title=[[Losing Our Religion: The Liberal Media's Attack on Christianity]] |isbn=978-1-4391-7316-9 |author=S. E. Cupp |publisher=Threshold Editions |page=10 |date=April 2010 |quote=I am an atheist. I have been an atheist for fifteen years. ... I believe ... that Judeo-Christian values, religious tolerance, an objective press, the benevolence of Christianity, and civility and decency make for a better American democracy.}} who âreally aspires to be a person of faith some day." She is an [[Italian-American]],{{cite | url= http://www.nydailynews.com/opinions/2009/12/30/2009-12-30_italians_blame_the_guidos__not_the_network.html | title = Italians, blame the 'guidos' on MTV's 'Jersey Shore' - not the network | author = S. E. Cupp | publisher = [[Daily News (New York)|NY Daily News]] | date = 2009-12-30 | quote = In the words of my Italian grandmother, "I give up."}} and a [[hunting|hunter]]. She currently lives in [[New York City]]. ==Journalist and commentator== In 2002, she was hired by the ''[[New York Times]]'' to write and edit for the Index Department. She is also a contributor to [[Politico.com|Politico.com's]] ''The Arena'', and a guest of [[Fox News|Fox]]'s ''[[Hannity]]'', ''[[Fox & Friends]]'', ''[[America Live with Megyn Kelly]]'', ''[[Strategy Room]]'', and ''[[Red Eye w/ Greg Gutfeld]]''. Her writings have appeared at ''[[The Washington Post]]'', ''[[New York Daily News]]'', [[Fox News|Foxnews.com]], ''[[The American Spectator]]'', ''[[Townhall]]'', ''[[Newsmax]]'', ''[[Human Events]]'', ''[[Slate (magazine)|Slate]]'', ''[[Maxim (magazine)|Maxim]]'', [[The Daily Caller]], [[SI.com]], and [[CNN|CNN.com]]. In 2009, she was hired as a columnist at the ''[[Daily News (New York)|Daily News]]''. In 2011, she was also hired as a writer and commentator for Mercury Radio Arts,http://www.glennbeck.com/2011/01/26/s-e-cupp-joins-glennbeck-com/ the organization owned and operated by [[Glenn Beck]]. Shortly after being hired by Beck, she was given her own show, "S.E. Cupp" on the Insider Extreme broadcast found on Glennbeck.com.http://www.theblaze.com/stories/beck-announces-s-e-cupp-will-join-radio-team-as-host/ That show has since moved to [[GBTV]]. ==Bibliography== * {{cite book | last = Cupp | first = S. E. | coauthor = Brett Joshpe | title = Why You're Wrong about the Right: Behind the Myths | publisher = Threshold Editions | location = New York | year = 2008 | isbn = 1416562826 }} * {{cite book | last = Cupp | first = S. E. | title = [[Losing Our Religion: The Liberal Media's Attack on Christianity]] | publisher = Threshold Editions | location = New York | year = 2010 | isbn = 1439173168 }} ==References== {{reflist|2}} ==External links== *{{Official website|http://www.redsecupp.com}} *{{IMDb name|3605759}} *[http://www.politico.com/arena/bio/s_e_cupp.html The Arena Profile] *[http://www.nydailynews.com/opinions/columnists/cupp/index.html Daily News Online column] {{Persondata |NAME=Cupp, Sarah Elizabeth |ALTERNATIVE NAMES= |SHORT DESCRIPTION=American conservative [[political commentator]] and writer |DATE OF BIRTH=February 23, 1979 |PLACE OF BIRTH=[[Carlsbad, California]] |DATE OF DEATH= |PLACE OF DEATH= }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Cupp, S.E.}} [[Category:1979 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Carlsbad, California]] [[Category:Cornell University alumni]] [[Category:American political writers]] [[Category:Human Events people]] [[Category:The American Spectator people]] [[Category:People from Essex County, Massachusetts]] [[Category:American atheists]] [[Category:New York University alumni]] [[Category:Conservatism in the United States]] [[Category:Former Roman Catholics]] [[Category:American ballet dancers]] [[Category:Ballerinas]] [[Category:Boston Ballet dancers]]
